meanings.definition: The action of changing or restoring something to a different or former position or state.
meanings.sent1: After the earthquake, the realignment of the furniture was necessary to make the room safe again.
meanings.sent2: The realignment of the books on the shelf made it look neat and organized.
meanings.sent3: During the game of musical chairs, the realignment of seats caused much laughter among the children.
meanings.sent4: The realignment of the planets in the solar system created a rare celestial event.
meanings.sent5: The realignment of the car's wheels improved its performance on the road.

meanings.definition: The process of making adjustments or changes to a system or organization in order to improve efficiency or effectiveness.
meanings.sent1: The company's realignment of its departments led to better communication and teamwork.
meanings.sent2: The realignment of the school schedule resulted in more productive class time.
meanings.sent3: The realignment of the cafeteria menu brought smiles to the students' faces.
meanings.sent4: The realignment of the business strategy helped increase profits significantly.
meanings.sent5: The realignment of the traffic flow reduced congestion in the city center.
